sources.title: Elmer Gantry (1960) Burt Lancaster · Jean Simmons
sources.description: Three-time Oscar-winning drama...  Skillfully toned-down excerpts from Sinclair Lewis 's novel, which portrays a hypocritical cult preacher and exposes the flaws in religious preaching and profiteering in the USA. A brilliant performance by Burt Lancaster .

metadata.Plot: Elmer Gantry is a fast-talking, hard-drinking traveling salesman who always has a risqué story and a hip flask to entertain cronies and customers alike. He is immediately taken with Sister Sharon Falconer, a lay preacher whose hellfire-and-damnation revivalism has attracted quite a following. Gantry uses his own quick wit and Bible knowledge to become an indispensable part of Sister Sharon's roadshow, but his past soon catches up with him in the form of Lulu Bains, now a prostitute. While Gantry seeks and eventually gets forgiveness from Sharon, tragedy strikes when she finally manages to get out of her revivalist tent and opens a permanent church.
metadata.Actors: Burt Lancaster, Jean Simmons, Arthur Kennedy
